Recognizes Japanese influence and Hagiwara story; some details about location and spread are a bit muddled.
Clear explanation that modern fortune cookies are an American invention influenced by Japanese traditions and early manufacturers.
States that cold weather directly makes people sick and weakens immunity; reinforces the myth instead of correcting it.
Clarifies that cold weather itself does not cause illness; explains how it can indirectly contribute to infections.
Correctly explains that antibiotics target bacteria and are not effective against viruses.

Clearly explains that bats are not blind and describes adaptations for low light and echolocation.
States that humans have more than five senses and lists additional sensory systems accurately.
Reinforces that humans have multiple senses beyond the classic five and gives detailed examples.
